blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_goods_and_services_section
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Goods and Services section.

In this section, you will provide information about the goods and services you provide under each SIN. You will need to complete a description, select your Preponderance of Work and indicate your offer category.

buttonStep.name: 02_select_sin_group_dropdown
buttonStep.text:
Select SIN group drop-down.

Click on the down-facing arrow to open the SIN Group drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 03_select_the_sin_group
buttonStep.text:
Select the SIN group.

You will see a list of SIN groups from which to choose.

For this lesson, select FSC 73 - Food Service Equipment, Supplies, and Services.

buttonStep.name: 04_confirm_your_selection
buttonStep.text:
Confirm your selection.

Click the Select SIN Group button to confirm your selection.

buttonStep.name: 05_open_the_sin_drop-down
buttonStep.text:
Open the SIN drop-down.

Click the down-facing arrow under the Add SIN(s) heading to open the drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 06_select_the_sin
buttonStep.text:
Select the SIN.

You will see a list of your SINs from which to choose.

For this lesson, select 302 20-Food Preparation Equipment.

buttonStep.name: 07_add_your_sin
buttonStep.text:
Add your SIN.

Click the Add SIN Details button

buttonStep.name: 08_open_the_naics_drop-down
buttonStep.text:
Open the NAICS drop-down.

Click on the down-facing arrow under the NAICS Code heading to open the drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 09_select_your_naics_code
buttonStep.text:
Select your NAICS code.

You will see a list of NAICS codes.

For this lesson, click on 312112.

buttonStep.name: 10_open_the_scope_drop-down
buttonStep.text:
Open the Scope drop-down.

Click on the down-facing arrow under the Scope heading.

buttonStep.name: 11_select_your_scope
buttonStep.text:
Select your Scope.

You will notice three possible choices in this drop-down.

For this lesson, click on Contractor will provide domestic delivery only.

inputStep.name: 12_enter_your_estimated_sales
inputStep.text:
Enter your Estimated Sales.

This field is for your company’s total projected annual sales to the government under a specific SIN.

For this lesson, enter a number. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: Error: Special Item Numbers (SINs) are sequences of numbers and letters that may be separated by spaces. For example "34 50C" is a valid SIN.

buttonStep.name: 13_respond_to_the_commercial_delivery_schedule
buttonStep.text:
Respond to the Commercial Delivery Schedule

You will see the question, "Will delivery be within 30 days after receipt of order (ARO)?"

For this lesson, click the radio button next to Yes.

inputStep.name: 14_enter_the_expedited_delivery_time
inputStep.text:
Enter the expedited delivery time.

Enter the expedited delivery time using a number representing days. Press Enter to validate and then click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: You must enter a number for this lesson. This number may not include any commas or other special characters. For example "365" is a valid number, but "1 year" and "2,231" are not.

buttonStep.name: 15_add_the_sin
buttonStep.text:
Add the SIN.

Click the Add This Sin button.

blankStep.name: 16_adding_multiple_sins
blankStep.text:
Adding multiple SINs.

You will notice your SIN has been added to the Your SIN(s) table. You could add more SINs if necessary, but you would have to do so one at a time.

For this lesson, we will only be adding one SIN.

buttonStep.name: 17_open_the_preponderance_of_work_drop-down
buttonStep.text:
Open the Preponderance of Work drop-down.

Click on the down-facing arrow to open the Preponderance of Work drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 18_select_your_preponderance_of_work
buttonStep.text:
Select your Preponderance of Work.

You will notice multiple NAICS codes in the drop-down.

For this lesson, click on 333319.

buttonStep.name: 19_add_preponderance_of_work
buttonStep.text:
Add Preponderance of Work.

Click the Add Preponderance of Work button.

buttonStep.name: 20_select_your_offer_category
buttonStep.text:
Select your Offer Category.

You will need to indicate if you are offering products, services, or both.

For this lesson, click the radio button next to Products Only.

buttonStep.name: 21_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click the Save and Continue button to ensure your information is not lost.

blankStep.name: 22_your_left-hand_navigation_has_changed
blankStep.text:
Your left-hand navigation has changed.

You will notice that your left-hand navigational menu has changed. The Wizard Management and Capture Pricing sections have been added for you to complete separately.

Be aware that Wizard Management will not appear in your menu if you select Services Only.

blankStep.name: 23_end_of_goods_and_services_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of Goods and Services lesson.

Click the Done button to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_wizard_management_section
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Wizard Management section.

Wizard Management provides you with a way of customizing the fields that will appear on your template and includes methods for entering details for product-related line ­items, uploading additional photos, generating an offer analysis report, and generating pricing documents.

buttonStep.name: 02_open_the_discounts_drop-down_menu
buttonStep.text:
Open the Discounts drop-down menu.

Click on the downward-facing arrow to open the Discounts drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 03_respond_to_the_discounts_section
buttonStep.text:
Respond to the Discounts section.

For this lesson, select Yes.

buttonStep.name: 04_select_the_discounts_level
buttonStep.text:
Select the Discounts Level.

You will click the radio button next to the level that applies to your SIN.

For this lesson, click the radio button next to Offer.

buttonStep.name: 05_select_the_delivery_level
buttonStep.text:
Select the Delivery Level.

Because the Delivery section is mandatory, Yes will automatically be selected in this field, so you will only need to indicate the level.

For this lesson, click the radio button next to SIN.

blankStep.name: 06_complete_the_remaining_fields
blankStep.text:
Complete the remaining fields.

For the purpose of this lesson, the remaining fields have been completed for you. Yes has been selected for each section.

You will also note that the Level has been predetermined for each field.

buttonStep.name: 07_save_your_responses
buttonStep.text:
Save your responses.

You MUST click the Save Responses button first or all of your data will be lost.

buttonStep.name: 08_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Only after you have clicked the Save Responses button should you then click the Continue button to continue to the next section.

blankStep.name: 09_your_left-hand_navigation_has_changed
blankStep.text:
Your left-hand navigation has changed.

You will notice that your left-hand navigational menu has changed.

Based on your selections in Wizard Management, new sections will be added to your menu.

blankStep.name: 10_end_of_the_wizard_management_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of the Wizard Management Lesson.

Click Done to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_zonal_pricing_section
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Zonal Pricing section.

In this section, you will set up your zone categories for each contiguous (CONUS) and non-contiguous (NON-CONUS) state by grouping them into self-defined zone numbers. You can choose any zone number between 01-10 you wish for each category of states.

You will indicate the pricing for your product/accessory according to zone in a separate section.

buttonStep.name: 02_open_the_zone_number_drop-down
buttonStep.text:
Open the Zone Number drop-down.

Click the downward-facing arrow to open the Zone Number drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 03_select_a_zone_number
buttonStep.text:
Select a Zone Number.

You will see a list of numbers from 01-10.

For this lesson, select 01.

buttonStep.name: 04_select_the_zonal_area
buttonStep.text:
Select the Zonal Area.

The radio buttons indicate whether the zone you are creating will include contiguous or non-contiguous states.

For this lesson, click the radio button next to CONUS.

buttonStep.name: 05_add_your_conus_zone
buttonStep.text:
Add your CONUS zone.

When you have selected all the states for your zone, click the Add Zone button.

buttonStep.name: 06_open_the_zone_number_drop-down_menu
buttonStep.text:
Open the Zone Number drop-down menu.

Click the downward-facing arrow to open the Zone Number drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 07_select_a_zone_number
buttonStep.text:
Select a Zone Number.

For this lesson, select 02.

buttonStep.name: 08_select_the_zonal_area
buttonStep.text:
Select the Zonal Area.

For this lesson, click the radio button next to NON-CONUS.

buttonStep.name: 09_add_your_non-conus_zone
buttonStep.text:
Add your NON-CONUS zone.

You will note that every box under the NON-CONUS heading has been checked. If you wanted to remove a state from any particular zone, you would simply need to uncheck the box next to its name.

For this lesson, leave each box checked and click the Add Zone button.

buttonStep.name: 10_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click the Save and Continue to Next Level button.

testStep.name: 11_knowledge_check
testStep.text:
Knowledge Check

True or False: Every single state must be represented in a zone before you can move on.

blankStep.name: 12_end_of_zonal_pricing_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of Zonal Pricing lesson.

Click the Done button to finish the first part of this lesson.

blankStep.name: 1_introduction_to_the_special_charges_section
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Special Charges section.

You will be able to make multiple selections from the list of special charges. You can choose as many charges as apply to your product(s).

buttonStep.name: 2_open_the_sin_drop-down_menu
buttonStep.text:
Open the SIN drop-down menu.

Click on the downward-facing arrow to open the SIN drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 3_choose_your_sin
buttonStep.text:
Choose your SIN.

You will see a list of your SINs in the drop-down.

For this lesson, choose 75 99.

buttonStep.name: 4_select_your_sin
buttonStep.text:
Select your SIN.

Click the Select button.

buttonStep.name: 5_uncheck_the_none_box
buttonStep.text:
Uncheck the None box.

The box next to None will be automatically checked. Uncheck this box before selecting your other charge(s).

buttonStep.name: 6_select_your_special_charges
buttonStep.text:
Select your special charges.

You can select as many special charges as are applicable to the products under this SIN.

For this lesson, check the box next to One Day Service.

buttonStep.name: 7_add_your_special_charges
buttonStep.text:
Add your Special Charges.

Click the Add Special Charges button.

buttonStep.name: 8_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Once your charges have been added to the table, click the Save and Continue button.

blankStep.name: 9_end_of_special_charges_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of Special Charges Lesson.

Click the Done button to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_special_features_section
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Special Features section.

You will be able to make selections from two different lists: Environmental Features and Special Features. You can make multiple selections of every feature that applies to your product(s).

buttonStep.name: 02_open_the_sin_drop-down_menu
buttonStep.text:
Open the SIN drop-down menu.

Click on the down-facing arrow to open the SIN drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 03_choose_your_sin
buttonStep.text:
Choose your SIN.

You will see a list of your SINs in the drop-down.

For this lesson, choose 75 99.

buttonStep.name: 04_select_your_sin
buttonStep.text:
Select your SIN.

Click the Select button.

buttonStep.name: 05_uncheck_the_none_box
buttonStep.text:
Uncheck the None box.

In the Environmental Features field, the checkbox next to None will be automatically checked.

For this lesson, uncheck that box.

buttonStep.name: 06_select_your_environmental_features
buttonStep.text:
Select your Environmental Features.

You can select as many environmental features as are applicable to the products under this SIN.

For this lesson, check the box next to Bio Preferred Item.

buttonStep.name: 07_uncheck_the_none_box
buttonStep.text:
Uncheck the None box.

In the Special Features field, the checkbox next to None will be automatically checked.

For this lesson, uncheck that box.

buttonStep.name: 08_select_your_special_features
buttonStep.text:
Select your Special Features.

You can select as many special features as are applicable to the products under this SIN.

For this lesson, check the box next to Ergonomic item.

buttonStep.name: 09_add_your_features
buttonStep.text:
Add your features.

Click the Add Special Features button.

buttonStep.name: 10_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Once your features have been added to the table, click the Save and Continue button.

blankStep.name: 11_end_of_special_features_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of Special Features Lesson.

Click the Done button to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_capture_and_generate_pricing_screen
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Capture and Generate Pricing screen.

Before you make your selection for a pricing template, you must have completed each section on your left-hand navigational menu. On this screen, you will see three options: Download/Upload Template, On-Screen Data Entry, and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI).

blankStep.name: 02_option_1_the download_upload_template
blankStep.text:
Option 1: The Download/Upload Template.

This method allows you to download an Excel template created by the system and work on it offline. After entering your data, you will need to upload the file back into the system to validate against any errors.

This method is best for entering more than 100 items.

blankStep.name: 03_option_2_on-screen_data_entry
blankStep.text:
Option 2: On-Screen Data Entry.

This method allows you enter product information into the template within the system. You are required to be online while working in this template.

This method is best for entering 100 items or fewer.

blankStep.name: 04_option_3_electronic_data_interchange
blankStep.text:
Option 3: Electronic Data Interchange (EDI).

This method allows you to download a template created by the system and work on it offline. You will be required to generate a transaction key and use it in the EDI system to upload your files.

This method is best for entering more than 100 items.

blankStep.name: 05_proceed_to_your_chosen_method
blankStep.text:
Proceed to your chosen method.

When you have chosen the method that most appropriately suits your need, click on the button within the option box to proceed.

blankStep.name: 06_proceed_to_your_chosen_method
blankStep.text:
End of Choosing a Pricing Method lesson.

Click Done to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_get_started_tab
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Get Started tab.

The Get Started tab is the first step in the On-Screen Data Entry process. This is where you will enter the Manufacturer Part Number and Name, as well as indicate whether you are offering a Product or Accessory. The information you enter here will be automatically transferred to subsequent tabs.

buttonStep.name: 02_open_the_sin_drop-down_menu
buttonStep.text:
Open the SIN drop-down menu.

Click the downward-facing arrow to open the SIN drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 03_select_your_sin
buttonStep.text:
Select your SIN.

For this lesson, select 75 99.

blankStep.name: 04_filling_out_the_first_row
blankStep.text:
Filling out the first row.

For this lesson, you are going to fill out the first row of the Get Started tab.

inputStep.name: 05_enter_the_manufacturer_part_number
inputStep.text:
Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

Example: DC9096

This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited in any way. You can enter up to 40 characters.

Type in a Manufacturer Part Number below. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: There is a 40 character limit.

inputStep.name: 06_type_a_manufacturer_part_name
inputStep.text:
Type a Manufacturer Part Name.

The Manufacturer Name is the name of the original manufacturer of the product and is a maximum of 40 characters.

Enter a Manufacturer Name into the cell below. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: There is a 40 character limit.

buttonStep.name: 07_open_the_drop-down_menu
buttonStep.text:
Open the drop-down menu.

Click in the text box to open the drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 08_select_the_product_type
buttonStep.text:
Select the Product Type.

For this lesson, select Product.

buttonStep.name: 09_save_after_completing_each_row
buttonStep.text:
Save after completing each row.

Click the Save Products button frequently while filling out this tab. If you do not save your work, it will be lost.

buttonStep.name: 10_confirm_saved_products
buttonStep.text:
Confirm saved products.

When the Product Confirmation pop-up message appears, click OK.

blankStep.name: 11_the_remaining_rows_have_been_completed_for_you
blankStep.text:
The remaining rows have been completed for you.

A maximum of 20 items will fit on the first page of the Get Started tab. Note how the screen will look with the first page completed.

blankStep.name: 12_add_more_products_accessories
blankStep.text:
Add more products/accessories.

When the first page of the Get Started tab has been filled, you can add more items on subsequent pages by clicking the Add More button.

For this lesson, we have already added another page. Note the pagination at the bottom of your screen has changed to include page 2.

blankStep.name: 13_end_of_get_started_tab_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of Get Started Tab Lesson.

Click the Done button to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_pricing_tab_lesson
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Pricing Tab lesson.

The Pricing tab is the most detailed section of the On-Screen Data Entry template. This is where you will enter specific information about your product or accessory, including a description, pricing details, and more.

blankStep.name: 02_note_the_auto-populated_information
blankStep.text:
Note the auto-populated information.

You will notice that the Manufacturer Part Number, Manufacturer Name, and Product/Accessory Type have been auto-populated from your responses on the Get Started tab.

Ensure each field is correct before moving on.

inputStep.name: 03_enter_the_product_accessory_name
inputStep.text:
Enter the Product/Accessory Name.

Example: 50" SAMSUNG LCD TV

Be sure to use the name that the manufacturer has given to the product.

For this lesson, type a product name into the cell. Press Enter to validate and click Next.

blankStep.name: 04_note_the_upc_field
blankStep.text:
Note the UPC field.

A Universal Product Code (UPC) is a unique identification code that is assigned to a product by a governing organization. UPCs can take several formats, ranging from 8 to 14 digits. Most products submitted for sale on a Federal Supply Schedule will follow the UPC-A 12 character format.

Click Next.

inputStep.name: 05_enter_the_vendors_product_accessory_description
inputStep.text:
Enter the Vendor’s Product/Accessory Description.

The vendor's product or accessory description is the description as created or provided by the seller. This description may be different than the description provided by the manufacturer.

For this lesson, type a Vendor Product Description into the cell and click Next.

buttonStep.name: 06_open_the_unit_of_issue_drop-down_menu
buttonStep.text:
Open the Unit of Issue drop-down menu.

The Unit of Issue describes in what format, quantity, or packaging a product will be sold. The most common unit of issue is "each," but other examples include, but are not limited to: "box," "pack," or "dozen."

Click on the downward-facing arrow to open the drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 07_select_the_unit_of_issue
buttonStep.text:
Select the Unit of Issue.

Example: Batteries are typically sold in packs, and if the packs you sell include 100 batteries in a pack, you would select 100-PACK for the Unit of Issue.

For this lesson, select EACH.

inputStep.name: 08_enter_the_quantity_per_unit
inputStep.text:
Enter the Quantity Per Unit.

Example: For a product like a laptop, which is usually sold individually, the unit of issue would most likely be "each" and the quantity per unit would be "1." However, with products like markers that are sold more than one in a package, the unit of issue would be "package" and the quantity per unit would be the number of markers in the package.

For this lesson, type a number into the Quantity Per Unit cell. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: Error: Quantities must be whole numbers and cannot contain commas or other special characters. For example, "10" is a valid quantity while "1,234" and "1 dozen" are not.

blankStep.name: 09_note_the_quantity_of_product_unit_field
blankStep.text:
Note the Quantity of Product/Unit field.

With a product such as a monitor, which is usually sold individually, the Unit of Issue would most likely be "each" and the quantity per unit would be "1." However, with products like markers that are sold more than one in a package, the unit of issue would be "package" and the quantity per unit would be the number of markers in the package.

Click Next.

blankStep.name: 10_note_the_vendor_part_number_field
blankStep.text:
Note the Vendor Part Number field.

The Vendor Part Number is an optional field used to identify a company-specific part number. This term is also known as the contractor's part number.

Click Next.

inputStep.name: 11_enter_the_commercial_list_price
inputStep.text:
Enter the Commercial List Price.

The Commercial List Price is the regular price that the vendor has been selling their product for, not including discounts.

For this lesson, enter a price. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: Prices must match the following format: "DOLLARS . CENTS". Where "DOLLARS" cannot include a "$" prefix or commas and "CENTS" can only have two to four digits. For example, "1234.12" and "1234.1234" are valid dollar amounts, but "$1,234.12" is not.

inputStep.name: 12_enter_the_best_priced_customer
inputStep.text:
Enter the Best Priced Customer.

The Best Priced Customer is the name of a customer or category of customers (commercial or government entity) in which your company offers the absolute best price, independent of terms and conditions, discounts, and/or concessions.

For this lesson, type a customer name. Press Enter to validate and click Next.

inputStep.name: 13_enter_the_price_offered_to_best_priced_customer
inputStep.text:
Enter the Price Offered to Best Priced Customer.

This is the best price you have offered to your Best Priced Customer from the previous field.

For this lesson, type a price into the cell. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: Prices must match the following format: "DOLLARS . CENTS". Where "DOLLARS" cannot include a "$" prefix or commas and "CENTS" can only have two to four digits. For example, "1234.12" and "1234.1234" are valid dollar amounts, but "$1,234.12" is not.

inputStep.name: 14_enter_the_discount_offered_to_best_priced_customer
inputStep.text:
Enter the Discount Offered to Best Priced Customer.

Example: If the price you offer to your Best Priced Customer is 5% less than your Commercial List Price, you should enter "5" in this field.

For this lesson, type a discount percentage into the cell. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: Discount percentages must be whole numbers less than 100 and cannot include either decimal points, percentage signs, or other special characters. For example, "4" is a valid discount percentage while "5%", "2.4", and "25.4%" are not.

blankStep.name: 15_note_the_manufacturer_warranty_warranty_period_drop-down
blankStep.text:
Note the Manufacturer Warranty - Warranty Period drop-down.

This is the unit of time that the warranty is expressed in. Available values are "day," "week," "month," "year," or "lifetime".

For this lesson, you do not need to complete this field. Click Next.

blankStep.name: 16_note_the_manufacturer_warranty_description_field
blankStep.text:
Note the Manufacturer Warranty - Description field

This is a description of the coverage provided by the manufacturer's warranty.

For this lesson, you do not need to complete this field. Click Next.

buttonStep.name: 17_open_the_production_point_drop-down
buttonStep.text:
Open the Production Point drop-down.

The production point is the country in which the product is manufactured.

Click on the downward-facing arrow to open the drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 18_select_your_production_point
buttonStep.text:
Select your Production Point.

For this lesson, select UNITED STATES OF AMERICA from the list.

blankStep.name: 19_note_the_production_point_2_drop-down_menu
blankStep.text:
Note the Production Point 2 drop-down menu.

If your product is manufactured in more than one country, use this field to indicate the additional country.

For this lesson, you do not need to complete this field. Click Next.

blankStep.name: 20_note_the_delivery_lead_time_days_field
blankStep.text:
Note the Delivery (Lead) Time Days field.

The delivery (lead) time days is the number of days it will take for the product to meet the established delivery (lead) time code. This field is for defining the numerical value only. For example, if you plan to select "AE" for your Delivery (Lead) Time Code and enter "5" into the Delivery (Lead) Time Days field, then the expectation is that the product will ship (leave your company) 5 days after you receive the order.

For this lesson, you do not need to complete this field. Click Next.

buttonStep.name: 21_open_the_delivery_lead_time_code_drop-down
buttonStep.text:
Open the Delivery (Lead) Time Code drop-down.

Use this field to identify the method in which your company determines delivery lead time. "AF" indicates the time the item will be delivered after receipt of order, and "AE" indicates the time shipped after receipt.

buttonStep.name: 22_select_the_delivery_lead_time_code
buttonStep.text:
Select the Delivery (Lead) Time Code.

For this lesson, select AF - Delivered after receipt of order.

blankStep.name: 23_note_the_final_code_fields
blankStep.text:
Note the final code fields.

The Federal Supply Code/Product Supply Code (FSC/PSC), United Nations Standard Products and Services Code (UNSPSC), and National Stock Number (NSN) are numerical indicators that further define an item.

For this lesson, you do not need to complete these fields. Click Next.

buttonStep.name: 24_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click the Save Pricing button to ensure the data you just entered is not lost.

blankStep.name: 25_completing_the_remaining_rows
blankStep.text:
Completing the remaining rows.

For this lesson, the remaining rows have been filled out for you.

Click Next.

blankStep.name: 26_end_of_pricing_tab_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of Pricing Tab Lesson

Click the Done button to end this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_additional_photos_tab
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Additional Photos Tab

After selecting Yes to Photos in Wizard Management, completing this tab is the second step to adding pictures of your product/accessory.

blankStep.name: 02_introduction_to_the_additional_photos_tab
blankStep.text:
Note the auto-populated information.

You will notice that some of the fields have auto-populated with information you entered in other fields. Ensure this data is correct before moving on.

inputStep.name: 03_enter_your_first_photos_filename
inputStep.text:
Enter your first photo’s filename.

In the Additional Photo 1 column, you will need to type the name of the photo, including the file extension, exactly as it is saved on your computer.

For this lesson, type photo_001.jpg into the textbox. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: You must enter "photo_001.jpg" for this lesson.

buttonStep.name: 04_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click the Save Photos button, located at the bottom of the table.

buttonStep.name: 05_click_ok
buttonStep.text:
Click OK.

When the Product Confirmation message pops up, click OK.

blankStep.name: 06_entering_additional_photos
blankStep.text:
Entering additional photos.

To enter more photos, simply type the exact photo name and file extension into the remaining text field(s) and save your information again.

For this lesson, the remaining rows have been completed for you.

blankStep.name: 07_uploading_your_photos
blankStep.text:
Uploading your photos.

You will upload your photos in a different step, once you have completed the entire On-Screen Data Entry process.

blankStep.name: 08_end_of_additional_photos_tab_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of Additional Photos tab lesson.

Click the Done button to continue.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_zonal_pricing_within_the_pricing_template
blankStep.text:
Introduction to Zonal Pricing within the pricing template.

Before you can enter your zonal details into the template, you must have indicated your zones for each contiguous and non-contiguous state in the Zonal Pricing section in the left-hand navigation menu.

blankStep.name: 02_note_the_auto-populated_information
blankStep.text:
Note the auto-populated information.

Some of the data you entered in previous tabs has been auto-populated into this tab. Double check that this information is correct before moving on.

inputStep.name: 03_enter_the_first_offer_price
inputStep.text:
Enter the first Offer Price.

The offer price is the price you will sell this product or accessory to government buyers, not including the Industrial Funding Fee (IFF).

You will recall we set up two zones in the Zonal Pricing section. 01 Offer Price ($) corresponds to the zone we labeled "01".

Type 100 into the cell under 01 Offer Price ($). Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: You must enter "100" for this lesson.

blankStep.name: 04_note_the_final_price
blankStep.text:
Note the Final Price.

The final price including industrial funding fee (IFF) is automatically calculated based on your offer price. It includes the IFF, which you will later remit to the government.

As soon as you click on this cell, the 01 Final Price (Incl. IFF) ($) field will be calculated for you.

Click Next.

blankStep.name: 05_note_the_markup_and_discount_to_gsa_fields
blankStep.text:
Note the Markup and Discount to GSA fields.

These fields correspond to the markup and GSA discount for the zone labelled "01," and are optional.

Click Next.

inputStep.name: 06_enter_the_second_offer_price
inputStep.text:
Enter the second Offer Price.

The second offer price corresponds to the zone we labeled "02."

Type 100 into the cell under 02 Offer Price ($). Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: You must enter "105" for this lesson.

blankStep.name: 07_note_the_second_final_price
blankStep.text:
Note the second Final Price.

The 02 Final Price (IFF) ($) field will be automatically calculated for you.

blankStep.name: 08_note_the_markup_and_discount_to_gsa_fields
blankStep.text:
Note the Markup and Discount to GSA fields.

These fields correspond to the markup and GSA discount for the zone labelled "01," and are optional.

Click Next.

buttonStep.name: 09_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click the Save Zonal Pricing button to ensure your data is not lost.

buttonStep.name: 10_click_ok
buttonStep.text:
Click OK.

On the Product Confirmation pop-up message, click OK.

blankStep.name: 11_end_of_zonal_offer_price_on-screen_data_entry
blankStep.text:
End of Zonal Offer Price: On-Screen Data Entry.

Click the Done button to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_special_charges_on-screen_data_entry_tab
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Special Charges: On-Screen Data Entry tab

You can only enter information into this tab after you have completed the Special Charges section found on the left-hand navigation menu.

blankStep.name: 02_note_the_auto-populated_information
blankStep.text:
Note the auto-populated information.

Some of the data you entered in previous tabs has been auto-populated into this tab. Double check that this information is correct before moving on.

buttonStep.name: 03_add_view_special_charges
buttonStep.text:
Add/View Special Charges.

Click the Add/View Special Charges button.

inputStep.name: 04_enter_your_charges
inputStep.text:
Enter your Charges.

If you selected more than one Special Charge in the previous section, you will see multiple rows in the Add Special Charges table.

For this lesson, enter a number in the Charges column corresponding to One Day Service. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: Prices must match the following format: "DOLLARS . CENTS". Where "DOLLARS" cannot include a "$" prefix or commas and "CENTS" can only have two to four digits. For example, "1234.12" and "1234.1234" are valid dollar amounts, but "$1,234.12" is not.

buttonStep.name: 05_open_the_per_drop-down_menu
buttonStep.text:
Open the "Per" drop-down menu.

Click on the down-facing arrow in the Per column to open the drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 06_select_your_unit_for_pricing
buttonStep.text:
Select your unit for pricing.

You will notice there are a number of choices from which to choose.

For this lesson, select EACH.

inputStep.name: 07_enter_your_descriptions_conditions
inputStep.text:
Enter your Descriptions/Conditions.

Example: A product includes One Day Service which costs $7.00 per item but is only applicable in the contiguous US.

Enter your Descriptions/Conditions. Press Enter to validate and click Next.

buttonStep.name: 08_save_your_special_charges
buttonStep.text:
Save your Special Charges.

Click the Save Special Charges button to ensure your work is not lost.

buttonStep.name: 09_click_ok
buttonStep.text:
Click OK.

Click OK on the Product Confirmation pop-up message.

blankStep.name: 10_end_of_special_charges_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of Special Charges lesson.

Click Done to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_special features_tab
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Special Features tab.

On this tab, you will use checkboxes to indicate which Special and Environmental Features apply to each of your products/accessories.

blankStep.name: 02_note_the_auto-populated_information
blankStep.text:
Note the auto-populated information.

You will notice that the Manufacturer Part Number, Manufacturer Name, and Product/Accessory Type have been auto-populated from your responses on the Get Started tab.

Ensure each field is correct before moving on.

buttonStep.name: 03_check_the_box_under_the_green seal_item_column
buttonStep.text:
Check the box under the Green Seal Item column.

For this lesson, click in the box under the Green Seal Item column to indicate this feature is associated with the product in the first row.

buttonStep.name: 04_check_the_box_under_the_ergonomic_item_column
buttonStep.text:
Check the box under the Ergonomic Item column.

For this lesson, click in the box under the Ergonomic Item column to indicate this feature is associated with the product in the first row.

blankStep.name: 05_note_the_completion_of_the_remaining_fields
blankStep.text:
Note the completion of the remaining fields.

We have completed the rest of the rows for you. Notice how some boxes remain unchecked. If a particular feature does not apply to your product/accessory, do not check the box for that row.

Click Next.

buttonStep.name: 06_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click the Save Special Features button to ensure your data is not lost.

buttonStep.name: 07_click_ok
buttonStep.text:
Click OK.

When the Product Confirmation box pops up, click OK.

blankStep.name: 08_End of On-Screen Data Entry: Special Features tab.
blankStep.text:
End of On-Screen Data Entry: Special Features tab.

Click Done to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_references_tabs
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the References tabs.

The Reference tab is the last tab in the Excel spreadsheet. In this tab you will find lists of names and codes for various fields, including Option Code, Unit of Issue, Special Features, and Delivery. You can refer to these lists when completing these fields in other tabs of the spreadsheet.

blankStep.name: 02_product_type
blankStep.text:
Product Type.

The Product Type field informs you that you can enter with "Product" or "Accessory" in any column named "Product Type".

blankStep.name: 03_warranty_periods
blankStep.text:
Warranty Periods.

This field indicates the options for both the Warranty Period and Extended Warranty Period.

blankStep.name: 04_discount_type
blankStep.text:
Discount Type.

This field indicates that there are two types of discounts: Volume/Quantity discounts and Dollar discounts.

blankStep.name: 05_option_code
blankStep.text:
Option Code.

The Option Code defines how the option relates to the base product. There are four potential values, which are defined as follows:

  • I - option is included as a feature of product, and cannot be removed
  • S - option can be substituted for another option
  • A - option can be added to the base product; it is not required to be selected
  • O - none can be selected.

blankStep.name: 06_delivery_lead_time
blankStep.text:
Delivery Lead Time

The Delivery Lead Time Code field helps you identify the method in which your company determines delivery lead time. The choices are as follows:

  • AF - delivered after receipt of order
  • AE - shipped after receipt of order

blankStep.name: 07_delivery_fob_conus
blankStep.text:
Delivery FOB - CONUS

Within the Delivery FOB - CONUS field, Free On Board (FOB) defines delivery options. Use these columns to help you determine the codes for the type of delivery you offer within the continental United States.

  • O - Origin - shipping is paid by the seller
  • D - Destination - shipping is paid by the buyer

blankStep.name: 08_delivery_fob_nonconus
blankStep.text:
Delivery FOB - NonCONUS

Within this field, Free On Board (FOB) defines delivery options. Use these columns to help you determine the codes for the type of delivery you offer within the non-contiguous US territories.

  • O - Origin - shipping is paid by the seller
  • D - Destination - shipping is paid by the buyer
  • ND - No Delivery - delivery is not offered to this destination

blankStep.name: 09_country_of_origin
blankStep.text:
Country of Origin

Locate the country in which your product/accessory was manufactured in the Country of Origin Name field. Directly to the left of the country's name is the corresponding code.

blankStep.name: 10_unit_of_issue
blankStep.text:
Unit of Issue

Unit of Issue describes the format, quantity, or packaging in which a product will be sold. To locate the code you will need to enter, first find the name of the unit you wish to enter, and look to the left for its corresponding code.

blankStep.name: 11_special_feature
blankStep.text:
Special Feature

To locate the Special Feature Code, first locate the feature in the Special Feature Message column. Directly to the left of the message, you will find the corresponding Special Feature Code. To the right, the Type column specifies if the feature is a Special Feature or an Environmental Feature.

blankStep.name: 12_special_feature
blankStep.text:
End of Reference Tab lesson.

Click the Done button to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_intro_to_the_pricing_tab
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Pricing Tab

This is a lesson on completing the Pricing tab in the Download/Upload Template. This template is where you will capture all of the pricing data for your products and/or accessories. This method allows you to download an Excel file created by the system and work on it offline. You should use this template if you have more than 100 items to enter.

blankStep.name: 02_intro_to_the_pricing_tab
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Pricing Tab

The Pricing tab is the first tab in the Excel spreadsheet and will capture basic information like the Manufacturer Name and Part Number.

blankStep.name: 03_open_the_downloaded_excel_file
blankStep.text:
Open the downloaded Excel file.

After downloading the template created by the system, open the Excel file (which will be named "PricingData.xls") to the Pricing tab.

inputStep.name: 04_enter_the_sin
inputStep.text:
Enter the SIN.

You can enter multiple SINs into this document, but we recommend completing each tab for one SIN at a time.

For this lesson, type 34 500 into the first cell under the *SIN heading. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: You must enter "34" SPACE "500" for this lesson.

inputStep.name: 05_enter_the_manufacturer_part_number
inputStep.text:
Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

Example: HSC0424PP

This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited in any way. You can enter up to 40 characters. Enter a Manufacturer Part Number into the cell. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: There is a 40 character limit.

inputStep.name: 06_type_a_manufacturer_name
inputStep.text:
Type a Manufacturer Name.

Examples: Honeywell, or Samsung, or DeWalt

The Manufacturer Name is the name of the original manufacturer of the product.

Enter a name, with a maximum of 40 characters, into the cell. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: There is a 40 character limit.

buttonStep.name: 07_enter_either_product_or_accessory
buttonStep.text:
Enter either Product or Accessory.

For this field, you will need to select either "Product" or "Accessory."

For this lesson, select Product from the dropdown menu and click Next.
buttonStep.errorAlert: ERROR: You must enter "Product" (with a capital "P") for this lesson.

buttonStep.name: 08_enter_either_product_or_accessory
buttonStep.text:
Enter either Product or Accessory.

For this field, you will need to select either "Product" or "Accessory."

For this lesson, select Product from the dropdown menu and click Next.
buttonStep.errorAlert: ERROR: You must enter "Product" (with a capital "P") for this lesson.

inputStep.name: 09_enter_the_product_name
inputStep.text:
Enter the Product Name.

Examples: laptop bag, refrigerator, laptop.

The product or accessory name is the name by which the product or accessory will be known. You must use the name that the manufacturer has given to the product.

For this lesson, type a Product Name into the cell. Press Enter to validate and click Next.

inputStep.name: 10_enter_the_upc
inputStep.text:
Enter the UPC.

A Universal Product Code (UPC) is a unique identification code that is assigned to a product by a governing organization.

Type a UPC between 8 and 14 digits into the cell, with no special characters. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: You must enter an 8 - 14 digit number.

inputStep.name: 11_vendor_part_number
inputStep.text:
Note the Vendor Part Number field.

The vendor part number is an optional field used to identify a company specific part number. This term is also known as the contractor's part number. Click Next.

inputStep.name: 12_enter_the_vendors_product_description
inputStep.text:
Enter the Vendor’s Product Description.

The vendor's product or accessory description is the description of the product or accessory, as created or provided by the seller. This description may be different than the description provided by the manufacturer.

Type a Vendor Product Description into the cell. Press Enter to validate and click Next.

buttonStep.name: 13_enter_the_unit_of_issue
buttonStep.text:
Enter the Unit of Issue.

Examples: each, box, or dozen.

The Unit of Issue describes in what format, quantity, or packaging a product will be sold. For a complete list of every Unit of Issue, see also the Reference tab.

For this lesson, select "EA - EACH" from the dropdown menu and click Next.
buttonStep.errorAlert: ERROR: You must enter "box" for this lesson.

buttonStep.name: 14_enter_the_unit_of_issue
buttonStep.text:
Enter the Unit of Issue.

Examples: each, box, or dozen.

The Unit of Issue describes in what format, quantity, or packaging a product will be sold. For a complete list of every Unit of Issue, see also the Reference tab.

For this lesson, select "EA - EACH" from the dropdown menu and click Next.
buttonStep.errorAlert: ERROR: You must enter "box" for this lesson.

inputStep.name: 15_enter_the_quantity_per_unit
inputStep.text:
Enter the Quantity Per Unit.

Example: Laptops are typically sold individually, so the Quantity Per Unit would be 1.

The quantity per unit is the number of individual units that are contained in a unit of issue.

For this lesson, type a number into the cell. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: You must enter a number such as "4" for this lesson.

blankStep.name: 16_note_the_quantity_of_product_unit_field
blankStep.text:
Note the Quantity of Product/Unit field.

Example: If you are selling a package of markers that contains 8 markers, then the unit of issue would be "package," the quantity per unit would be "8," and the quantity of product/unit would be "each."

The quantity of product per unit further defines the quantity per unit. It is selected from the list of units of issue.

Click Next.

blankStep.name: 17_end_of_pricing_tab_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of Pricing Tab lesson.

Click the Done button to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_download_upload_template_special_charges_tab
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Download/Upload Template: Special Charges tab.

For this tab, you will need to enter basic information for each special charge.

inputStep.name: 02_enter_your_sin
inputStep.text:
Enter your SIN.

Type a SIN into the first empty cell. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: Error: Error: Special Item Numbers (SINs) are sequences of letters and/or numbers that may be separated by spaces. For example "34 500" is a valid SIN.

inputStep.name: 03_enter_your_manufacturer_part_number
inputStep.text:
Enter your Manufacturer Part Number.

This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited in any way. You can enter up to 40 characters.

Type in a Manufacturer Part Number below. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: There is a 40 character limit.

inputStep.name: 04_enter_your_manufacturer_name
inputStep.text:
Enter your Manufacturer Name.

The manufacturer name is the name of the original manufacturer of the product and is a maximum of 40 characters.

Enter a Manufacturer Part Name into the cell below. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: There is a 40 character limit.

blankStep.name: 05_recall_your_earlier_selections
blankStep.text:
Recall your earlier selections.

You will need to complete the rows for the charge(s) you indicated in the previous Special Charges section.

For this lesson, you will recall we chose One Day Service.

blankStep.name: 06_scroll_to_the_charge_that_applies_to_your_offer
blankStep.text:
Scroll to the charge that applies to your offer.

You only need to complete the columns pertaining to the charges that apply to your items. For any charge that does not apply to your items, you can leave that column blank.

For this lesson, we used the scroll bar to find the columns for One Day Service because that was the selection we made in the previous Special Charges section.

inputStep.name: 07_enter_your_one_day_service_charges
inputStep.text:
Enter your One Day Service charges.

Enter the number (in dollars) that you will charge for this service. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: Prices must match the following format: "DOLLARS . CENTS". Where "DOLLARS" cannot include a "$" prefix or commas and "CENTS" can only have two to four digits. For example, "1234.12" and "1234.1234" are valid dollar amounts, but "$1,234.12" is not.

buttonStep.name: 08_enter_your_one_day_service_per
buttonStep.text:
Enter your One Day Service - Per.

Using the drop-down menu, locate the Unit of Issue that pertains to your item and enter the corresponding code in this field. For a complete list of every Unit of Issue, see also the Reference tab.

buttonStep.name: 09_enter_your_one_day_service_per
buttonStep.text:
Enter your One Day Service - Per.

Using the drop-down menu, locate the Unit of Issue that pertains to your item and enter the corresponding code in this field. For a complete list of every Unit of Issue, see also the Reference tab.

inputStep.name: 10_enter_your_one_day_service_description
inputStep.text:
Enter your One Day Service - Description.

Press Enter to validate and click Next.

buttonStep.name: 11_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click the Save button to ensure your work is not lost.

blankStep.name: 12_end_of_the_download_upload_template_special_charges_tab
blankStep.text:
End of Download/Upload: Special Charges Lesson

Click Done to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_photos_tab
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Photos tab.

The Photos tab on the Download/Upload Template is the second step to adding photos to your particular SIN. You must have answered "Yes" to Photos in the Wizard Management section before you can complete this step.

Files must be 1.0 MB or less, and only .jpg, .gif, and .zip file types will be accepted.

inputStep.name: 02_enter_your_sin
inputStep.text:
Enter your SIN.

You can enter multiple SINs into this document, but we recommend completing each tab for one SIN at a time.

For this lesson, type a SIN into the first cell under the *SIN heading. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: Error: Special Item Numbers (SINs) are sequences of numbers and letters that may be separated by spaces. For example "34 50C" is a valid SIN.

inputStep.name: 03_enter_the_manufacturer_part_number
inputStep.text:
Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

Example: HSC0424PP

This field should be entered exactly as provided by the manufacturer, and should not be edited in any way. You can enter up to 40 characters.

Enter a Manufacturer Part Number into the cell. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: There is a 40 character limit.

inputStep.name: 04_type_a_manufacturer_name
inputStep.text:
Type a Manufacturer Name.

Examples: Honeywell, or Samsung, or DeWalt

The Manufacturer Name is the name of the original manufacturer of the product.

Enter a name, with a maximum of 40 characters, into the cell. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: There is a 40 character limit.

inputStep.name: 05_enter_your_first_photos_filename
inputStep.text:
Enter your first photo’s filename.

In the Additional Photo 1 column, you will need to type the name of the photo, including the file extension, exactly as it is saved on your computer.

For this lesson, type a photo name using the permitted conventions into the textbox. Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: Photo file names can only end in ".jpg", ".jpeg", ".gif", or ".zip". Also file paths such as "folder/file.jpg" are not allowed. For example "photo.jpg" and "photo 001.jpeg" are valid while "folder/photo.jpg" and "photo.png" are not.

blankStep.name: 06_adding_more_photos
blankStep.text:
Adding more photos.

If you wish to add more than one photo, simply enter the other filename(s) into the column under Additional Photo 2 and Additional Photo 3 (you can only add up to three photos).

Click Next.

buttonStep.name: 07_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click the Save icon to ensure your data isn’t lost.

blankStep.name: 08_end_of_download_upload_template_photos_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of Download/Upload Template: Photos lesson.

Click the Done button to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_generate_offer_analysis_report_section
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Generate Offer Analysis Report section.

Upon entering all required product-related details, you will need to send your information to a third-party database for standardization. You will do that in this section.

buttonStep.name: 02_initiate_generate_offer_analysis_report
buttonStep.text:
Initiate Generate Offer Analysis Report.

On the Capture and Generate Pricing home screen, click on the Generate Offer Analysis Report button.

buttonStep.name: 03_note_the_in_progress_status
buttonStep.text:
Note the "In Progress" status.

If the status of your report reads "In Progress," it is still generating and not yet ready for the next step.

Click the Check Status link.

buttonStep.name: 04_note_the_complete_status
buttonStep.text:
Note the "Complete" status.

When the system has finished running your report, you will notice that the status has changed to "Complete." There will also be a link to view your report.

Click the Go To Offer Analysis Report button.

buttonStep.name: 05_you_will_be_taken_to_a_screen
buttonStep.text:
You will be taken to a screen that includes all of the fields that require action.

For this lesson, we will need to fix the pricing section.

Click the View/Edit Pricing button.

blankStep.name: 06_note_the_target_price_field
blankStep.text:
Note the Target Price (Incl. IFF) field.

This field indicates the target numbers at which a particular item should be priced. The prices we entered are too high and need to be adjusted.

Click Next.

inputStep.name: 07_adjust_the_new_offer_price_for_zone_1
inputStep.text:
Adjust the New Offer Price for Zone 1.

We have deleted the New Offer Price for Zone 1. To enter the adjusted price, type 80.00.

Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: You must enter "80.00" for this lesson.

blankStep.name: 08_notice_the_final_price_has_changed
blankStep.text:
Notice the Final Price (Incl. FF) has changed.

The Final Price (Incl. IFF) for Zone 1 has changed to reflect the adjusted price you just entered.

Click Next.

inputStep.name: 09_adjust_the_new_offer_price_for_zone_2
inputStep.text:
Adjust the New Offer Price for Zone 2.

We have deleted the New Offer Price for Zone 2. To enter the adjusted price, type 75.00.

Press Enter to validate and click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: You must enter "75.00" for this lesson.

blankStep.name: 10_notice_the_final_price_has_changed
blankStep.text:
Notice the Final Price (Incl. FF) has changed.

The Final Price (Incl. IFF) for Zone 2 has changed to reflect the adjusted price you just entered.

Press Enter to validate and click Next.

buttonStep.name: 11_save_ your_ work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click the Save Changes button.

buttonStep.name: 12_click_ok
buttonStep.text:
Click OK.

Click OK on the Standard Response Confirmation pop-up message.

buttonStep.name: 13_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

You will notice the table in the Line Items: Require Action tab is now empty. This indicates you have corrected all of your errors.

Click the Save Standard Responses button.

buttonStep.name: 14_click_ok
buttonStep.text:
Click OK.

Click OK on the Standard Response Confirmation pop-up message.

blankStep.name: 15_you_will_be_taken_back_to_the_capture_and_generate_pricing_screen
blankStep.text:
You will be taken back to the Capture and Generate Pricing screen.

The Offer Analysis Report section is now complete.

blankStep.name: 16_end_of_the_generate_offer_analysis_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of the Generate Offer Analysis Lesson.

Click Done to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_generate_pricing_document_section
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Generate Pricing Document section.

This is the final step in the pricing process that will trigger the generation of the pricing document. You must have completed every other section in the pricing process before you can move onto this step.

buttonStep.name: 02_click_the_generate_pricing_document_button
buttonStep.text:
Click the Generate Pricing Document button.

Once you have generated your Offer Analysis Report and all errors have been corrected, you are ready to begin the process of generating your Pricing Document.

Click the Generate Pricing Document button.

buttonStep.name: 03_check_the_status_of_your_pricing_document
buttonStep.text:
Check the status of your Pricing Document.

Generation of your document may take up to 30 minutes, but you can check the status at any time by clicking this button. You will need to click this button until the message changes from "In Progress" to "Complete."

Click the Check Status button.

buttonStep.name: 04_view_final_pricing_document
buttonStep.text:
View Final Pricing Document.

Once the status is "Complete," you will see a link called "View Final Pricing Document."

Click that link.

blankStep.name: 05_review_your_pricing_document
blankStep.text:
Review your Pricing Document.

This document includes all of the information you have entered throughout the Formatted Products Tool process. You may save a copy of this for your records.

Click Next.

blankStep.name: 06_end_of_generate_pricing_document_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of Generate Pricing Document lesson.

Click the Done button to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_the_add_sin_modification_lesson
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Add SIN Modification lesson.

The first part of the Add SIN modification lesson will cover the initial steps in adding a SIN to your contract. Here, you will enter your SIN details and select your Scope and offer category.

buttonStep.name: 02_select_the_add_sin_modification
buttonStep.text:
Select the Add SIN modification.

In the Pricing section in the list of modification subtypes, you will see "Add SIN." Click the radio button next to this mod.

buttonStep.name: 03_submit_your_selection
buttonStep.text:
Submit your selection.

Click the Submit Online button at the bottom of the screen.

blankStep.name: 04_verify_your_corporate_information
blankStep.text:
Verify your Corporate Information.

Verify your Corporate Information. Click Next.

buttonStep.name: 05_save_and_continue
buttonStep.text:
Save and Continue.

After verifying that your information is correct, click the Save and Continue button.

buttonStep.name: 06_click_continue
buttonStep.text:
Click Continue

On the Information Saved screen, click Continue.

buttonStep.name: 07_open_the_select_sin_drop-down_menu
buttonStep.text:
Open the Select SIN drop-down menu.

Click on the downward-facing arrow to open the drop-down.

buttonStep.name: 08_select_a_sin
buttonStep.text:
Select a SIN.

While you can add multiple SINs in this mod, you can only add one at a time.

For this lesson, select 71 398-International Products.

buttonStep.name: 09_access_the_add_sin_details_screen
buttonStep.text:
Access the Add SIN Details screen.

Click on the Add SIN Details button.

buttonStep.name: 10_open_the_scope_drop-down_menu
buttonStep.text:
Open the Scope drop-down menu.

Click on the downward-facing arrow to open the Scope drop-down.

buttonStep.name: 11_select_your_scope
buttonStep.text:
Select your Scope.

For this SIN, select 50 States, DC.

buttonStep.name: 12_add_your_sin
buttonStep.text:
Add your SIN.

Click the Add This SIN button.

blankStep.name: 13_your_sin_has_been_added_to_the_table
blankStep.text:
Your SIN has been added to the table.

You will see your SIN details added to the Your SIN(s) table.

Click Next.

blankStep.name: 14_revising_your_commercial_sales_practice
blankStep.text:
Revising your Commercial Sales Practice.

You will need to determine if you have to revise your Commercial Sales Practice (CSP). This section is outlined in detail in the Update/Revise Commercial Sales Practice section of the eOffer/eMod User Guide.

Click Next.

buttonStep.name: 15_select_your_offer_category
buttonStep.text:
Select your Offer Category.

For this lesson, click the radio button next to "Products and Services."

buttonStep.name: 16_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click the Save and Continue button.

blankStep.name: 17_end_of_add_sin_modification_lesson_initial_steps
blankStep.text:
End of Add SIN Modification Lesson: Initial Steps.

Click Done to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_tpr_initial_steps_lesson
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Temporary Price Reduction Modification Lesson: Part I.

This is the first of four lessons on the Temporary Price Reduction mod. For a more complete picture of this modification, be sure to complete any of the lessons following this one that apply to your contract.

blankStep.name: 02_scroll_down_to_the_appropriate_section
blankStep.text:
Scroll down to the appropriate section.

Using the scroll bar, locate the Pricing section.

Click Next.

buttonStep.name: 03_select_the_temporary_price_reduction_modification
buttonStep.text:
Select the Temporary Price Reduction modification.

In the Pricing section in the list of modification subtypes, you will see "Temporary Price Reduction." Click the radio button next to this mod.

buttonStep.name: 04_submit_your_selection
buttonStep.text:
Submit your selection.

Click the Submit Online button at the bottom of the screen.

blankStep.name: 05_verify_your_corporate_information
blankStep.text:
Verify your Corporate Information.

Verify your Corporate Information and click Next.

buttonStep.name: 06_save_and_continue
buttonStep.text:
Save and Continue.

After verifying that your information is correct, click the Save and Continue button.

buttonStep.name: 07_click_continue
buttonStep.text:
Click Continue.

On the Information Saved screen, click Continue.

buttonStep.name: 08_revising_your_commercial_sales_practice
buttonStep.text:
Revising your Commercial Sales Practice.

You will need to determine if you have to revise your Commercial Sales Practice (CSP). This section is outlined in detail in the Update/Revise Commercial Sales Practice section of the eOffer/eMod User Guide.

For this lesson, click the radio button next to "No."

buttonStep.name: 09_save_your_selection
buttonStep.text:
Save your selection.

After making your selection, click the Save button.

buttonStep.name: 10_select_your_sins
buttonStep.text:
Select your SIN(s).

You will need to select the SIN(s) under which the temporary price reduction applies. While you can add multiple SINs at a time, we will only be adding one.

For this lesson, click on 426 4C.

buttonStep.name: 11_add_your_sin_to_the_selected_sins_text_box
buttonStep.text:
Add your SIN to the Selected SIN(s) text box.

To add the SIN you have chosen, click on the button with the right-facing arrows.

inputStep.name: 12_enter_your_description
inputStep.text:
Enter your description.

You will need to enter a detailed description of your modification request. For this lesson, enter a maximum of 1024 characters in the text box.

Press Enter to validate, then click Next.

buttonStep.name: 12_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click the Save and Continue button.

blankStep.name: 13_end_of_tpr_initial_steps
blankStep.text:
End of Temporary Price Reduction Modification: Part I.

Click Done to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_introduction_to_tpr_dl_ul_lesson
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Temporary Price Reduction Modification Lesson: Download/Upload Template.

This lesson will cover the Download/Upload method for entering your data. This method will allow you to download a template created by the system and work on it offline. This method is best for entering 100 or more items.

buttonStep.name: 02_proceed_to_the_download_template
buttonStep.text:
Proceed to the Download Template.

Click on the Proceed to Download Template button.

buttonStep.name: 03_download_the_template
buttonStep.text:
Download the template.

Click on the Download button.

inputStep.name: 04_enter_your_sin
inputStep.text:
Enter your SIN.

After opening your downloaded file, enter your SIN.

For this lesson, enter 426 4D. Press Enter to validate, then click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: Error: Special Item Numbers (SINs) are sequences of numbers and letters that may be separated by spaces. For example "34 50C" is a valid SIN.

inputStep.name: 05_enter_the_manufacturer_part_number
inputStep.text:
Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

Next, type a Manufacturer Part Number of up to 40 characters in the corresponding cell.

Press Enter to validate, then click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: There is a 40 character limit.

inputStep.name: 06_enter_the_manufacturer_name
inputStep.text:
Enter the Manufacturer Name.

Enter a name, with a maximum of 40 characters, into the cell. Press Enter to validate, then click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: There is a 40 character limit.

inputStep.name: 07_enter_the_start_date_of_the_price_reduction
inputStep.text:
Enter the Start Date of the price reduction.

Enter a date, using the MM/DD/YYYY convention, into the text box.

Press Enter to validate, then click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: Error: For this lesson, you must enter a valid date. Dates must follow the MM/DD/YYYY convention. Specifically, months and days must be represented by two digits, while years must be represented by four digits. For example, "June 26, 2012" should be entered as "06/26/2012".

inputStep.name: 08_enter_the_end_date_of_the_price_reduction
inputStep.text:
Enter the End Date of the price reduction.

Enter a date, using the MM/DD/YYYY convention, into the text box.

Press Enter to validate, then click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: Error: For this lesson, you must enter a valid date. Dates must follow the MM/DD/YYYY convention. Specifically, months and days must be represented by two digits, while years must be represented by four digits. For example, "June 26, 2012" should be entered as "06/26/2012".

inputStep.name: 09_enter_the_zone_number
inputStep.text:
Enter the Zone Number.

Enter a Zone Number from 1-10 into the cell.

Press Enter to validate, then click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: Error: You must enter a number between 1 - 10 to complete this step.

inputStep.name: 10_enter_the_proposed_price
inputStep.text:
Enter the Proposed Price (Excluding IFF).

Enter a price into the cell.

Press Enter to validate, then click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: Prices must match the following format: "DOLLARS . CENTS". Where "DOLLARS" cannot include a "$" prefix or commas and "CENTS" can only have two to four digits. For example, "1234.12" and "1234.1234" are valid dollar amounts, but "$1,234.12" is not.

buttonStep.name: 11_save_your_work
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click on the "Save" icon located in the upper-left corner of the file.

blankStep.name: 12_end_of_tpr_dl_ul
blankStep.text:
End of the Temporary Price Reduction Modification Lesson: Download/Upload Template.

Click Done to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_intro_to_tpr_on_screen_data_entry
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the the Temporary Price Reduction Modification: On-Screen Data Entry lesson.

The On-Screen Data Entry method allows you to enter your details into the system online. This method is best for entering 100 items or fewer.

buttonStep.name: 02_open the sin drop-down menu.
buttonStep.text:
Open the SIN drop-down menu.

Click on the downward-facing arrow to open the SIN drop-down.

buttonStep.name: 03_select_the_sin
buttonStep.text:
Select the SIN.

For this lesson, select 426 4C.

inputStep.name: 04_enter_the_manufacturer_part_number
inputStep.text:
Enter the Manufacturer Part Number.

Example: 123 456

The Manufacturer Part Number can consist of a maximum of 40 characters.

For this lesson, enter a manufacturer part number into the cell below.

Press Enter to validate, then click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: There is a 40 character limit.

inputStep.name: 05_enter_the_manufacturer_name
inputStep.text:
Enter the Manufacturer Name.

Example: LENOVO

The Manufacturer Name can consist of a maximum of 40 characters.

For this lesson, enter a manufacturer name into the cell below.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: There is a 40 character limit.

inputStep.name: 06_enter_the_zone_number
inputStep.text:
Enter the Zone Number.

The Zone Number must consist of a two-digit number between 01-10.

For this lesson, type 01.
inputStep.errorAlert: Error: You must enter a <u>two digit</u> zone number between 01-10. For example, "05" is a valid zone number.

buttonStep.name: 07_search_for_your_product
buttonStep.text:
Search for your product.

Click the Search button.

blankStep.name: 08_note_the_auto-populated_information
blankStep.text:
Note the auto-populated information.

Several fields have been auto-populated with data related to your product.

inputStep.name: 09_enter_the_date_the_price_reduction_will_begin
inputStep.text:
Enter the date the price reduction will begin.

Example: 08/23/2016

In the Start Date field, enter a date into the field.

Press Enter to validate, then click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: Error: For this lesson, you must enter a valid date. Dates must follow the MM/DD/YYYY convention. Specifically, months and days must be represented by two digits, while years must be represented by four digits. For example, "June 26, 2012" should be entered as "06/26/2012".

inputStep.name: 10_enter_the_date_the_price_reduction_will_end
inputStep.text:
Enter the date the price reduction will end.

Example: 08/23/2017

In the End Date field, enter a date into the field.

Press Enter to validate, then click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: Error: For this lesson, you must enter a valid date. Dates must follow the MM/DD/YYYY convention. Specifically, months and days must be represented by two digits, while years must be represented by four digits. For example, "June 26, 2012" should be entered as "06/26/2012".

inputStep.name: 11_enter_the_proposed_price
inputStep.text:
Enter the Proposed Price (Excluding IFF).

Example: 34.95

Enter a price into the Proposed Price field.

Press Enter to validate, then click Next.
inputStep.errorAlert: ERROR: Prices must match the following format: "DOLLARS . CENTS". Where "DOLLARS" cannot include a "$" prefix or commas and "CENTS" can only have two to four digits. For example, "1234.12" and "1234.1234" are valid dollar amounts, but "$1,234.12" is not.

buttonStep.name: 12_add_the_product
buttonStep.text:
Add the product.

Click the Add Product for Temporary Price Reduction button.

blankStep.name: 13_note_the_product_information_table
blankStep.text:
Note the product information table.

If you scroll down on the page, you will see that the information you entered has been added to a table at the bottom of the screen.

Click Next.

buttonStep.name: 14_go_to_the_capture_pricing_section
buttonStep.text:
Go to the Capture Pricing section.

Click the Go To Capture Pricing button.

blankStep.name: 15_end_of_tpr_on_screen_data_entry
blankStep.text:
End of the Temporary Price Reduction Modification Lesson: On-Screen Data Entry.

Click Done to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_intro_to_tpr_generate_pricing_document
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Temporary Price Reduction Modification: Generate Pricing Document lesson.

In this lesson, you will learn how to generate and view your Final Pricing Document. You must complete this step before you can upload any additional documents and submit your modification.

buttonStep.name: 02_begin_the_process_to_generate_your_pricing_document
buttonStep.text:
Begin the process to generate your Pricing Document.

Click on the Generate Pricing Document button.

blankStep.name: 03_note_the_generation_status
blankStep.text:
Note the generation status.

Your status will first display as "In Progress."

buttonStep.name: 04_check_your_status
buttonStep.text:
Check your status.

To refresh the status of your document, click the Check Status button.

buttonStep.name: 05_view_your_pricing_document
buttonStep.text:
View your Pricing Document.

When your status changes to "Complete," you will be able to open your document.

Click on the View Final Pricing Document link.

blankStep.name: 06_review_and_save_your_final_pricing_document
blankStep.text:
Review and save your Final Pricing Document.

Once your file opens and you have reviewed it, be sure to save a copy of it for your records.

blankStep.name: 07_end_of_tpr_generate_pricing_document_lesson
blankStep.text:
End of the Temporary Price Reduction Modification: Generate Pricing Document lesson.

Click Done to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_cfp_initial
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Capture Formatted Pricing Modification lesson.

This modification allows you to enter your pricing information into the system using the Formatted Product Tool process. This mod will capture data related to your zonal pricing, special charges, photos, and more.

blankStep.name: 02_cfp_initial
blankStep.text:
Scroll down to the Pricing section.

Use the scroll bar until you see the Pricing section.

buttonStep.name: 03_cfp_initial
buttonStep.text:
Select the Capture Formatted Pricing modification.

In the Pricing section in the list of modification subtypes, you will see "Capture Formatted Pricing." Click the radio button next to this mod.

buttonStep.name: 04_cfp_initial
buttonStep.text:
Submit your selection.

Click the Submit Online button at the bottom of the screen.

blankStep.name: 05_cfp_initial
blankStep.text:
Verify your Corporate Information.

Verify your Corporate Information and click Next.

buttonStep.name: 06_cfp_initial
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

After verifying your information, click the Save and Continue button.

buttonStep.name: 07_cfp_initial
buttonStep.text:
Click Continue.

On the Information Saved screen, click Continue.

inputStep.name: 08_cfp_initial
inputStep.text:
Add a detailed modification description.

A detailed description of your modification request is required. For this lesson, enter a maximum of 1024 characters in the text box. Press Enter to verify, then click Next.

buttonStep.name: 09_cfp_initial
buttonStep.text:
Select your Offer Category.

For this lesson, click on the radio button next to Products and Services.

buttonStep.name: 10_cfp_initial
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click on the Save and Continue button.

buttonStep.name: 11_cfp_initial
buttonStep.text:
Click Continue.

On the Information Saved screen, click Continue.

buttonStep.name: 12_cfp_initial
buttonStep.text:
Open the Point of Contact Information drop-down menu.

Click on the downward-facing arrow to open the Point of Contact Information drop-down.

buttonStep.name: 13_cfp_initial
buttonStep.text:
Select your Point of Contact.

The selections in your drop-down menu will depend on the contacts you have previously added. For this lesson, click on Order POC.

buttonStep.name: 14_cfp_initial
buttonStep.text:
Click the Add Point of Contact Details button.

Click on the Add Point of Contact Details button.

blankStep.name: 15_cfp_initial
blankStep.text:
Your Order Point of Contact.

You will be required to enter contact information for the person who is designated to be contacted for contract administration. Required fields are marked with a red asterisk. Click Next.

blankStep.name: 16_cfp_initial
blankStep.text:
Entering your Order POC information.

For instructional purposes, we have completed each required field for you. Click Next.

buttonStep.name: 17_cfp_initial
buttonStep.text:
Add your POC information.

Click the Add Point of Contact Information button.

blankStep.name: 18_cfp_initial
blankStep.text:
Your contact has been added to the table.

You will see your Order POC information added to a table. Click Next.

buttonStep.name: 19_cfp_initial
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Click the Save and Continue button.

blankStep.name: 20_cfp_initial
blankStep.text:
End of Capture Formatted Pricing Modification Part I: Initial Steps.

Click Done to complete this lesson.

blankStep.name: 01_cfp_wizard
blankStep.text:
Introduction to the Wizard Management section.

Wizard Management provides you with a way of customizing the fields that will appear on your template and includes methods for entering details for product-related line ­items, uploading additional photos, generating an offer analysis report, and generating pricing documents.

buttonStep.name: 02_cfp_wizard
buttonStep.text:
Open the Discounts drop-down menu.

Click on the downward-facing arrow to open the Discounts drop-down menu.

buttonStep.name: 03_cfp_wizard
buttonStep.text:
Respond to the Discounts section.

For this lesson, select Yes.

buttonStep.name: 04_cfp_wizard
buttonStep.text:
Select the Discounts Level.

You will click the radio button next to the level that applies to your SIN. For this lesson, click the radio button next to Contract Level.

buttonStep.name: 05_cfp_wizard
buttonStep.text:
Select the Delivery Level.

Because the Delivery section is mandatory, "Yes" will automatically be selected in this field, so you will only need to indicate the level. For this lesson, click the radio button next to SIN Level.

blankStep.name: 06_cfp_wizard
blankStep.text:
Completing the remaining fields.

For the purpose of this lesson, the remaining fields have been completed for you. Yes has been selected for each section. You will also note that the Level has been predetermined for each field.

buttonStep.name: 07_cfp_wizard
buttonStep.text:
Save your responses.

You MUST click the Save Wizard Responses button first or all of your data will be lost.

buttonStep.name: 08_cfp_wizard
buttonStep.text:
Save your work.

Only after you have clicked the Save Wizard Responses button should you then click the Save and Continue button to continue to the next section.

blankStep.name: 09_cfp_wizard
blankStep.text:
Your left-hand navigation has changed.

You will notice that your left-hand navigational menu has changed. Based on your selections in Wizard Management, new sections will be added to your menu as well as in the Capture Pricing section.

blankStep.name: 10_cfp_wizard
blankStep.text:
End of the Capture Formatted Pricing Modification Lesson Part II: Wizard Management.

Click Done to complete this lesson.
